Pitch
========================================================

It's a very simple task to build a presentation with rmarkdown!


Pitch ...
========================================================

To write a list like this:

- Bullet 1
- Bullet 2
- Bullet 3

You write:
```
- Bullet 1
- Bullet 2
- Bullet 3
```


Pitch ...
========================================================

Or show them incrementaly like this:

>- Bullet 1
>- Bullet 2
>- Bullet 3



You can include the execution of some code
========================================================

```{r}
summary(cars)
```

Or include a plot
========================================================

```{r, echo=FALSE}
plot(cars)
```

For more details on authoring R presentations please visit <https://support.rstudio.com/hc/en-us/articles/200486468>.
